summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from September 2019 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) in the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Javier A. Solano. The emails discuss scheduling and the government's interest in interviewing Solano's client, referred to as 'Estill', regarding the Epstein matter, noting an ICE detainer on the client.

persons.name: Javier A. Solano
persons.context: Attorney representing a client named Estill, communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to schedule a proffer session and inquire about the government's interest in interviewing his client regarding the Epstein matter.

persons.name: Estill
persons.context: Client of attorney Javier A. Solano who is the subject of an ICE detainer. The government was considering interviewing him regarding the Epstein matter.

connections.description: Solano is the legal representative for Estill, arranging a proffer session with prosecutors and inquiring about his immigration status.
Professional correspondence regarding scheduling a proffer session for Solano's client and the government's investigative interest.

events.title: ICE Detainer Confirmed for Estill
events.description: An AUSA confirms to attorney Javier Solano that his client Estill has an ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) detainer.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session for Estill was scheduled for the afternoon of September 3, 2019, at the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Government Interest in Epstein Interview Questioned
events.description: Attorney Solano forwards an inquiry asking if the government is still interested in interviewing his client regarding the Epstein matter, prompting an internal AUSA question about whether to proceed.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Empire State Building, 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 5900, New York, New York 10118
The Hub, 507 Willis Avenue, Bronx, New York 10455
keyFacts: In September 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was in contact with a defense attorney regarding a potential interview of his client 'Estill' about the Epstein matter.
The client Estill was subject to an ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) detainer, which was a factor in considering bail and interview logistics.
The email chain shows the government's active consideration, as of late 2019, of interviewing individuals potentially connected to the Epstein investigation.
The correspondence is professional and focused on scheduling a proffer session, indicating a cooperative but formal investigative process.
